meanings.definition: A person or thing that ameliorates a situation or condition.
meanings.sent1: The volunteers were the ameliorators of the community, always helping those in need.
meanings.sent2: The ameliorators worked tirelessly to improve the living conditions in the village.
meanings.sent3: The ameliorators threw a surprise party to make the sad situation a bit brighter.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness acted as an ameliorator, soothing the pain in people's hearts.
meanings.sent5: The ameliorators were like shining stars, bringing hope to everyone they met.

meanings.definition: Those who improve or make something better.
meanings.sent1: In the story, the ameliorators were the ones who fixed all the broken toys.
meanings.sent2: The ameliorators in the group always came up with creative solutions to problems.
meanings.sent3: The ameliorators decided to throw a party to celebrate the successful project.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like ameliorators, turning his frown into a smile.
meanings.sent5: The team of ameliorators transformed the old building into a beautiful library.
